page.title: 12ORCHIDS OF WYCHWOOD FOREST
page.content: The {ORCHIDS }are one of the largest flower families in the world,with up to 30,000 species.Within the forest six types have been identified, but there are {hybrids }also. The most often seen are the {COMMON SPOTTED {ORCHID }and the {TWAYBLADE.}Rarer are the {PYRAMID ORCHID }and {EARLY {PURPLE ORCHID,}while very rarely seen is the {SOUTHERN MARSH ORCHID}. Avery rare hybrid is the {LEOPARD {MARSH ORCHID,}which is a cross between {SOUTHERN MARSH ORCHID }and the{COMMON {SPOTTED ORCHID. }The {BROAD LEAVED {HELLIBORINE }is another rare orchid sometimes seen in the forest. Unfortunately orchids are a favour- ite {food }of the {Fallow Deer}and many plants have been eradicated by them over the years. Others are in danger from meadow and bracken mowing { }
